column2: Description           The VFX Supervisor is responsible for the production of visual effects on the project that is assigned to him. A key consultant of the project s Director, he is responsible for the technical and artistic quality of the shots. The standard of quality is established during his exchanges with the Director and production staff. He must therefore understand and interpret the Director s intentions and also be conscious of the project s budget constraints set by the production team. He works in collaboration with the Post-Production Manager on tasks such as budget, planning and client relations.               Responsibilities             PRE-PRODUCTION:         Prepare the visual effects production breakdown;     Participate in pre-production meetings;     Anticipate problems and present solutions adapted to time and budget constraints;     Recruit and manage pre-production teams, if necessary;         FILMING:         Supervise the filming of VFX sequences: retrieve filming information, oversee the necessary on-set installations for the filming of sequences;         POST-PRODUCTION:          Recruit and manage teams for production;     Maintain communications between the Director and the production team;     Support the coordination team in order to maintain the pipeline s efficiency and allow the artists and TDs to achieve their production objectives and deadlines;     Identify additional tools necessary for production; find and develop solutions in collaboration with the TDs;     Evaluate the utility of new tools/software that are available on the market;     Monitor technological developments;                 Qualifications             Minimum five (5) years of work experience as a VFX supervisor in a film production environment, animated TV series or visual effects;     Extensive knowledge of VFX production and CG pipelines;     Thorough understanding of film production and on-set experience;     Experience with recruitment, training and supervision of CG artists;     Knowledge of an asset manager is a plus;     Knowledge of various 2D/3D software (Maya, Nuke, etc.) is a plus;     Excellent organizational and communication skills;     Excellent project management skills;     Ability to supervise and assign tasks to a production team;     Must be attentive to the production team, the other supervisors and the coordinators;     Bilingual (English and Hindi);     Must be willing and able to travel
column11: Supervisor, Post production, Visual Effects, TDS, Project management, Maya, Director, VFX, Monitoring, Recruitment

column2: Extensive experience and a strong portfolio showcasing proficiency in creating real-time visual effects for video games.      In-depth knowledge and understanding of real-time physics, fluid systems, and tools (such as Houdini) used in VFX creation. Proven expertise in using industry-standard tools, including but not limited to UE4, Niagara, Unity, Maya, and Photoshop, to create in-game VFX content.      Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills, enabling effective collaboration with team members and clients.      Minimum of 5 years of experience in creating real-time VFX for video games, with a track record of contributing to the development and release of AAA titles.          Demonstrated leadership skills, including previous experience in a management or lead role in the video game or services industry.      Strong organizational and project management abilities to ensure timely delivery of high-quality VFX content within budgetary constraints.      Proactive and self-driven with a focus on achieving exceptional results and ensuring client satisfaction.              Responsibilities:        Lead and supervise the VFX team in creating in-engine, performant, high-quality visual effects in standard (Unreal, Unity) and proprietary game engines.      Collaborate closely with the Art Director, Technical Art Director, Lighting and Design team to ensure the overall visual direction and quality of the VFX.      Work with the VFX leadership team to develop and document technical specifications, pipelines, and best practices for VFX creation.      Mentor and develop junior VFX artists by providing guidance, feedback, and support as needed.      Collaborate with other artists within the studio as well as clients across various projects to ensure the seamless integration of VFX into the game.      Ensure compliance with clients requirements and internal best practices across all projects.      Work with fellow artists and Project Managers to create asset lists, schedules, and budgets for VFX related tasks.      Coordinate with key stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of top-quality, game-ready, and optimized VFX content within budget constraints.      Review and provide constructive feedback on VFX assets created by the team, ensuring they meet the projects visual and technical standards.      Research and stay up to date with the latest industry trends and techniques in real-time physics, fluid systems, and VFX tools.      Collaborate with the Technical Art Directors and other relevant team members to develop and optimize custom shaders and scripts for enhancing the quality of VFX.      Continuously improve the VFX creation pipeline, tools, and processes to maximize efficiency and quality.

column2: 1. Improve conversion rates on Docyt website and other marketing channels.      2. Ask clarifying questions when receiving an assignment, so you deliver the right work on tight deadlines. Ideally, you will be a thought partner with Marketing.      3. Maximum attention to detail and delivering the final work product with minimal revisions.        Responsibilities:         Responsible for branding marketing assets, and take complete ownership of visual and graphic work for all marketing and sales collateral - e.g. website, paid ads, social media, email, direct mail - across digital, print, and trade shows.      Responsible for storyboarding and creation of educational and training videos, marketing and sales videos, animations, and other video editing projects.     Work closely with the Digital Marketing Manager and Marketing Director to ensure designs are on time and flawlessly executed.      Work cross-functionally with all the teams including Sales, Operations, Customer Success, and Product to ensure the data used in marketing assets makes sense. e.g. financial data     When working on Docyt software products, work with product designers to help maintain a consistent and brand-adhering visual design system across platforms to ensure an integrated brand perception and user experience.     Establish best practices and maintain brand integrity by regulating brand guidelines for the use of Docyt logo, typography, messaging, and imagery.     Maintain a shared folder to organize and update design assets and deliverables.         Fluent in English.     Excellent visual, written and verbal communication skills, along with presentation and negotiation skills.     A penchant for details and organization, including the ability to prioritize tasks, communicate progress, and meet deadlines.     The ability to effectively take direction and work both collaboratively and autonomously.     Strong problem-solving skills.     Exceptional project management skills, e.g. very detail oriented and deadline driven.     Patient and kind; you are eager to give and receive constructive feedback in a transparent work environment.         Design Skills         A firm grasp of the Adobe Creative Suite, particularly InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and After Effects.      Experience with Figma, Sketch, Principle, and Affinity software.      A solid foundation in typography, layout and design.     Experience with brand guidelines in order to create layouts that reinforce Docyts brand style or voice through its visual touchpoints     Design logos, icons and infographics     Design user-centered interaction models, wireframes or screen mockups     Understand web design issues, including browser usability, cross-platform compatibility, and responsive design.     Experience with transitions, animation, motion design and dynamic interaction.     Skilled in print design, e.g. color spaces, bleeding, etc.      Skilled in trade show booth graphics and design.      Have basic coding knowledge so you can work hand-in-hand with coders.     Create and organize production assets     Juggle multiple projects while effectively managing timelines and expectations     Great taste and proven ability in visual design, composition, and art direction for large-scale, multi-channel marketing campaigns.         Bonus:         Bachelor s degree in visual/graphic design or animation or equivalent courses along with the required industry experience.         Other         5+ years of experience and an available online portfolio that demonstrates evolution of projects from idea to pixel-perfection.     Must be available to work in US shift Hours (8:30pm - 12:30am India Standard Time)         FTE employment opportunity at an early stage Silicon Valley-based startup     Employee stock options     Comprehensive medical coverage     Company provided laptop

column2: Skill required:  Marketing Operations - Creative Design Designation:  Motion Design Senior Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 5 to 8 years  What would you do? Seeking a skilled and experienced Motion Designer to support our creative team in crafting visually stunning and engaging motion graphics and animations. The ideal candidate will possess a strong portfolio showcasing their expertise in motion design across various platforms, including digital, social media, and broadcast with 6-7yrs of experience. As a Motion Designer, for video, you will be responsible for producing best quality motion design videos and work on the entire motion design process, from concept development to final execution, ensuring high-quality deliverables that align with our brand vision and objectives. Role requires Digital Marketing Ads & Promotion creation/designCreative design is a process that uses digital and physical design tools and core design training to create comps and final art that bring creative concepts to life for marketing purposes. What are we looking for? Bachelor s degree in Graphic Design is plus, Motion Design, Animation, or a related field Diploma/Certificate. Proven experience in motion/graphic design, with a strong portfolio showcasing expertise in creating dynamic and engaging motion graphics and animations. Proficiency in industry-standard software such as Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere Pro, Cinema 4D, or similar tools. Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a creative team. Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and allocate resources effectively.  Roles and Responsibilities:  1.Produce high quality motion designs for video projects as per client and creative lead instructions.2.Lead a team of motion designers, providing mentorship, guidance, and feedback to foster growth and development.3.Produce videos with best concept designs and brand guidelines to follow the campaign story.4.Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including creative directors, graphic designers, and video producers, to conceptualize and execute compelling motion graphics and animations that effectively communicate our brand message and storytelling.5.Drive innovation and creativity by staying updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in motion design, integrating new techniques and tools into our workflow.6.Manage multiple projects simultaneously, establishing priorities, timelines, and resource allocation to ensure timely delivery of high-quality assets within budget constraints.7.Develop and maintain production pipelines, standards, and workflows to streamline the motion design process and optimize efficiency.8.Conduct regular reviews and quality checks to uphold design standards and ensure consistency across all deliverables.9.Collaborate with external vendors/agencies as needed, to ensure adherence to project requirements and timelines.10.Stay informed about project status, feedback, and revisions, facilitating clear communication and collaboration among team members and stakeholders.11.Provide leadership in problem-solving and decision-making, resolving issues and challenges that arise during the production process.12.Uphold a positive and collaborative work environment, fostering teamwork, creativity, and a culture of continuous improvement. Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Skill required:  Graphic and Visual Design - Visual Design Designation:  Graphic & Visual Design Senior Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 5 to 8 years  About Accenture Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security.Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services, and Accenture Song all powered by the worlds largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.Visit us at www.accenture.com  What would you do? About Accenture:At Accenture, we believe your career is about what you want to be and who you want to be. It's about bringing your skills, your curiosity, and your best true self to your work. Here, you'll match your ingenuity with the latest technology to do incredible things. Together, we can create positive, long-lasting change.We Are:Sales Excellence. Sales Excellence at Accenture empowers our people to compete, win and grow. We develop everything they need to grow their client portfolios, optimize their deals and enable their sales talent, all driven by sales intelligence.You Are:A visual storyteller with a keen eye for detail. Your approach to work mixes imagination with discipline. This allows you to think outside of the box, while working within brand guidelines. A creative collaborator with the ability to adapt to feedback, you thrive in a fast-paced environment. What are we looking for? Here's what you need: Minimum of 3 years' experience as a graphic designer and/or desktop publisher working in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint on PC platform Minimum of 1 year professional experience in any of these Adobe apps:Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Acrobat Completion of provided Graphic Design skills assessment Advanced command of the English language [other language requirements per MU specification/needs]Extra credit if you have: Portfolio with relevant work examples Experience with proposal response development Bachelors degree, preferably in Graphic Design or related disciplineYou May Also Need: A home office or work area that is suitable for productive remote work, per local guidelines. This includes a safe, ergonomic workspace and a high-speed internet connection that is stable and secure.  Roles and Responsibilities:  The Work:The Pursuit Services Graphic Design team creates engaging visual concepts and supporting graphics to highlight key sales messages and emphasize win themes in a variety of pursuit deliverables.You collaborate with sales teams to develop creative concepts that resonate with Accenture's clients. Working primarily in Word and PowerPoint, you create and format proposal documents that conform to client requirements and Accenture brand guidelines. You translate complex data into compelling infographics. Primary responsibilities include:  Demonstrate advanced MS Word, PowerPoint, and Adobe Acrobat Pro skills  Apply insights to develop client-focused visual concepts  Adhere to design best practices  Apply page layout design and consistent formatting to proposal documents  Create clear infographics to visualize data  Follow workflow process, using appropriate templates, tools, and repositories  Help prepare files for printing and/or online submission  Organize and archive graphic design assets

column2: As a Visual designer with an emphasis on communications, UI, Marketing and branding, we are looking at you to be an expert in telling compelling stories through design. You may be responsible for creative concept or design execution within a diverse team of strategists, writers, or video production or Even UI design for a tech-project. You will work with different stakeholders across a range of projects from internal product development to external client support.                        Key Responsibilities:             Design Leadership:                Provide creative direction and leadership in the development of design concepts and strategies.                Collaborate with other departments to understand project requirements and objectives.                Stay updated on industry trends and incorporate innovative design approaches.                Project Management:                Manage multiple design projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and high-quality outcomes.                Work closely with project managers to define project scopes, timelines, and resource requirements.                Team Collaboration:                Collaborate with other designers, copywriters, and cross-functional teams to ensure consistent branding across all materials.                Mentor and guide junior designers, fostering a collaborative and supportive team environment.                Design Execution:                Produce high-quality visual designs, including but not limited to digital assets, print materials, branding elements, and multimedia content.                Ensure designs adhere to brand guidelines and effectively communicate the intended message.                Client Interaction:                Engage with clients to understand their design needs and preferences.                Present design concepts and articulate the rationale behind creative decisions.                Technology Proficiency:                Stay proficient in design software and tools necessary for the role.                Stay informed about emerging design technologies and methodologies.                  Qualifications:                 Bachelors degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, or a related field.                Proven experience (5-7 years) in a design role, with a strong portfolio showcasing a variety of design projects.                Proficiency in design software such as Adobe Creative Suite.                Strong understanding of design principles, color theory, and typography.                Excellent communication and presentation skills.                Leadership and mentorship abilities.                Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.                Knowledge of industry trends and a passion for staying updated on design innovations.                  Additional Skills (depending on the industry):                 UX/UI design skills for digital products.                Knowledge of 3D modeling and animation.                Experience with design for social media platforms.

column2: Associate UX Designer, the Associate Product Designer the primary role of a product designer is to advocate for the user, understand user needs and goals, conduct user research, and create designs that meet user needs       A significant part of the role is communication     Product designers consistently communicate user pain points and design iterations to the product, managers, developers, and business stakeholders     The product designer consistently tests the design and working software throughout development and iterates on the design                  Key Responsibilities:                   Pair with the senior and principal level designer to support the full life cycle of systems and applications by working iteratively within a balanced team of Product Managers and Software Engineers to deliver incrementally while progressing toward valuable outcomes.         Follow User Centric Design practices led by Lead and Senior Designers consisting of end user s needs, wants, and limitations, being the focus at all stages of the Design and Product Development life cycles.         Follow Design Discovery & Framing practices from research initiatives and ideation testing prototypes.         Follow existing design systems, data visualizations, and visual design guidelines to drive outcomes.                   The Contribution:                   Work independently and collaboratively within a balanced product team to designing complex multi-sided systems or enterprise software.         Be responsible for wireframing, interaction design, prototyping, design documentation and pairing with UX Engineering.         Collaborate closely with Senior and Principal level product designers.         Follow design and DesignOps to DevOps workflows and processes to ensure we deliver excellence with predictability at scale.         Optimize our Experience Platforms, Tools (ie Figma, Miro, Monday, zeroheight), and Practices, how and when we use them.                   What you need to succeed                   Able to apply empathy-first and a yes, and mindset to get stuff done.         Passion for user experience and design practices         2-4 years experience as a UX Designer or Digital Product Designer, creating and/or improving transactional websites or software products. Formal degree or training in HCI, Product Design, Interaction Design, Visual Design or related fields or equivalent job experience.         Strong communication, facilitation, coordination, and organization skills

column1: STAFF UX Designer - Product Design/Visual Design / Service Design
column2: Extreme seeks a Digital Product Designer (UX Designer); this individual contributor (IC) collaborated on discovery, framing, validation, and design execution within a balanced team of Product Managers and Software Engineers to deliver incrementally while progressing toward valuable outcomes     We are a team of passionate, creative technologists, UX Designers, UX Writers, UX Researchers, UX Strategists, and experience innovators who will build and deliver technology-centric solutions that accelerate a customer-first experience via adopting the Extreme Design System     You will feel like you're working in a start-up with the stability and knowledge of a leading technology company     Senior Product Design - Senior UX Designer, the Senior Product Designer the primary role of a product designer is to advocate for the user, understand user needs and goals, conduct user research, and create designs that meet user needs.      A significant part of the role is communication. Product designers consistently communicate user pain points and design iterations to the product, managers, developers, and business stakeholders.      The product designer consistently tests the design and working software throughout development and iterates on the design.           Key Responsibilities:               Be a leader with a vision to help advance Extreme s experience strategy globally and challenge others to change and adopt modern experience methodologies.     Full life cycle of systems and applications by working iteratively as a Design expert within a balanced team of Product Managers and Software Engineers to deliver incrementally while progressing toward valuable outcomes.     Facilitate User Research initiatives across teams.     Develop User Centric Design practices consisting of end user s needs, wants, and limitations, being the focus at all stages of the Design and Product Development life cycles.     Present Design Discovery & Framing with inputs from research initiatives and ideation testing prototypes while providing valuable synthesis and recommendations to the key stakeholders and users at Extreme Networks     Contribute to the design systems, data visualizations, and visual design for feedback and testing to drive adoptable outcomes.     Lead cross-functional Consulting and Collaboration, demonstrating leadership by helping the team and stakeholders navigate product vision, high-level business priorities and desired outcomes.     Participate in Scoping, Design Thinking, Kick-Off, and other workshops with other team members eventually assuming the role of inception facilitator.     Support design reviews to ensure the production of high-quality design artifacts across the team of designers.     Educates partners like product management and engineering on design practices.     Assist with recruiting and hiring.         The Contribution:               Facilitating workshops, work independently and collaboratively within a balanced product team to designing complex multi-sided systems or enterprise software.     Guide product design decisions through user research, development, and iterative feedback.     Establishing and improving design and DesignOps to DevOps workflows and processes to ensure we deliver excellence with predictability at scale.     Be responsible for wireframing, interaction design, prototyping, design documentation and pairing with UX Engineering.     Optimize our Experience Platforms, Tools (ie Figma, Miro, Monday, zeroheight), and Practices, how and when we use them.     Follow lean startup and pairing methods with UX Engineering to ensure what was designed and validated gets built.         What you need to succeed               Able to apply empathy-first and a yes, and.. mindset to get stuff done.     Deep experience in at least one of the following design skills: User Research, Interaction Design, Visual Design or Service Design     Experience working within a product teams, including collaborating with designers, content strategists, researchers, UX engineers, and product management.     8- 12+ years experience as a UX Designer or Digital Product Designer, creating and/or improving transactional websites or software products. Formal degree or training in HCI, Product Design, Interaction Design, Visual Design or related fields or equivalent job experience.     An exemplar of excellent communication, facilitation, coordination, and organization skills

Manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines without compromising quality.   Push   creative   boundaries,   while   still   being   on-brand   and   aligned   to   the   Impact goals. WHAT   WE   ARE   LOOKING   FOR  Minimum 2+ years of work experience in the visual communication design/ graphic design, preferably in an agency or start-up environment  Bachelors degree in visual communication or a related field or equivalent  Fluent in one Indian language (two languages is a significant plus), in addition to  English  Hands-on experience in using design softwares, including InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and a willingness to bring new things to the table.  High attention to visual details, highly motivated, proactive, and experience working  with minimal supervision; and ability to meet deadlines collaboratively  Have a genuine empathic curiosity in how to communicate with diverse audiences,  particularly those with low literacy and living in rural settings  Passionate about contributing to the intersection of social impact, visual communication, and human-centered design and always ask:  Who   am   I   designing for?  Experience working in creative, human-centered culture and cross-cultural design,  and excited to use your talents in a Social Impact context  Ability to travel to the field WHAT   WE   VALUE At Noora Health, we value diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we understand the value of developing a team with different perspectives, educational backgrounds, and life experiences. We prioritize diversity within our team, and we welcome candidates from all gender identities, castes, religious practices, sexual orientations, and abilities  among many others. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for positions at Noora Health. HOW   TO   APPLY Email the following materials with the subject line  Visual   Designer   |   Bangalore  to https://noorahealth.org/careers/ email : people@noorahealth.org  A one-page cover letter describing your interest in the position and background.  An updated resume, including languages spoken and relevant experiences.  2+ Samples of a complete project with the Latest Portfolio www.noorahealth.org

column2: Docyt is seeking a visionary Principal Visual Designer to lead our design efforts and drive our brand forward. As a Principal Visual Designer, you will play a critical role in shaping the visual identity of our products and marketing materials. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to create compelling designs that resonate with our audience and drive engagement.     Responsibilities         Strategic Design Leadership:    Lead the development and execution of our visual design strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals and user needs. Drive innovation and excellence in visual design across all touch-points.       Creative Direction   : Provide creative direction and guidance to the design team, inspiring them to push the boundaries of design and deliver exceptional work. Foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and continuous improvement.       Brand Stewardship   : Own and evolve the Docyt brand identity, ensuring consistency and coherence across all design assets and channels. Establish and maintain brand guidelines to ensure a unified brand experience.       User-Centric Design   : Advocate for the user throughout the design process, incorporating user feedback and insights to create intuitive and delightful experiences. Champion accessibility and inclusivity in design practices.       Cross-Functional Collaboration   : Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Marketers, and other stakeholders to translate business requirements and user needs into impactful design solutions. Foster a spirit of collaboration and teamwork.       Design System Development   : Lead the development and maintenance of our design system, creating reusable components and design patterns to streamline the design process and maintain consistency across products.       Mentorship and Development   : Mentor and coach junior designers, providing guidance, feedback, and support to help them grow and excel in their roles. Foster a culture of learning and professional development.       Experience         7+ years of experience in visual design, with a proven track record of designing impactful digital and print collateral.     Experience working on consumer-facing products and marketing campaigns.     Experience leading design projects from concept to execution, with a strong portfolio showcasing your design expertise and creative vision.         Skills         Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, or equivalent.     Strong understanding of design principles, typography, layout, and color theory.     Experience with animation, motion design, and prototyping tools.     Knowledge of front-end development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.     Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to articulate and defend design decisions.     Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.     Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.         Full-time employment opportunity at an early-stage Silicon Valley-based startup.         Competitive salary and equity compensation.     Comprehensive medical coverage.     Flexible work arrangements and a supportive work environment.     Opportunities for professional growth and development.         If you're passionate about design, innovation, and making a meaningful impact, we'd love to hear from you! Join us at Docyt and help shape the future of financial management

column2: Role & responsibilities     As an Information Designer / Scientific Graphic Designer, you will be at the forefront of visualizing complex data and information. This role is not just about creating visually appealing content; it's about storytelling, turning data into engaging narratives that resonate with our diverse audience. Your expertise will bridge the gap between data science and design, making intricate concepts accessible and engaging through innovative visualizations. Additionally, your experience in UX design, wireframing, and prototyping will contribute to creating intuitive and actionable interfaces that enhance our consultancys digital presence and client interaction platforms. Design and deliver top-notch      infographics, charts, and visual content, transforming complex data into      compelling visual stories. Employ storytelling      techniques in data visualization to enhance the interpretability and      impact of content. Collaborate with consultants      to deeply understand the data, crafting visuals that accurately represent      insights in an intuitive manner. Ensure visual content      adheres to our brand standards while pushing the envelope in data      visualization and information design. Utilize UX design principles      to contribute to the development of wireframes and prototypes for digital      products, enhancing user experience and interaction. Keep abreast of the latest      trends in information design, UX/UI design, and data visualization tools,      integrating innovative practices into your work. Coordinate with marketing      and digital teams to create consistent, user-centered designs across all      platforms, including web and mobile applications. Manage projects from concept      through execution, ensuring timely delivery and high-quality output. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelors or Masters      degree in Graphic Design, Information Design, UX/UI Design, Data      Visualization, or related fields. Min. 2 years of experience. Strong portfolio showcasing      expertise in information design, data storytelling, and, if applicable, UX      design, wireframing, and prototyping. Proficient in design and      visualization software (Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, Tableau,      Power BI, Canva etc.). Exceptional storytelling      skills, with the ability to translate complex data into engaging and      understandable visual narratives. Experience in UX/UI design,      including wireframing and prototyping, is highly desirable. Excellent analytical,      communication, and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to work      across different teams and disciplines. column2: Position : Visual Designer We are seeking a talented and experienced Visual Designer to join our family. The ideal candidate would have a strong understanding of web design principles and will be responsible for creating visually appealing and user-friendly websites. The Visual Designer will work closely with the development team to ensure that the design and functionality of each website meet the high standards that our clients expect. If you are passionate about designing beautiful and functional websites and enjoy working in a collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Responsibilities : - Collaborate with clients and team members to identify website design requirements. - Develop website layouts and designs using industry-standard design software and tools. - Create mock-ups and prototypes to present to clients and make revisions as needed. - Design and optimize websites for a variety of devices, including desktops, tablets, and mobile phones (mobile websites). - Ensure website design is accessible and adheres to web accessibility guidelines (ADA, FGPR and other equivalent compliances). - Stay up-to-date with current design trends and techniques and incorporate them into website design projects - Work with developers to ensure that website design is implemented correctly and meets all technical requirements. - Perform quality assurance checks to ensure that websites are functioning properly and are visually appealing. - Collaborate with the marketing team to create effective and visually appealing marketing materials, such as email templates, social media graphics, banners etc. Qualifications : - 0-2 years of experience in website designing. - Should have a bachelor's degree, preferably in a design-related field. - Strong portfolio that demonstrates an understanding of design principles, typography (fonts), colour theory, iconography, illustration and layout design. - Proficiency in industry-standard design software, such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, XD/ Figma) and similar alternative programs. - Experienced in using a template-driven application (WordPress, Wix, Squarespace Drupal etc.) the initial configuration, modifications, and design enhancements. - Experience designing responsive websites that adapt to different screen sizes. - Ability to work independently and as part of a team. - Strong communication and collaboration skills. - Attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. - Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a plus.
